section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Carrier" means:
an insurer;
a nonprofit health service plan; or
a health maintenance organization.

"Child dependent" means an individual who:
is:
is a dependent of the insured as that term is used in 26 U.S.C. §§ 104, 105, and 106, and any regulations adopted under those sections;
is unmarried; and
is under the age of 25 years.

This section applies to:
each policy of individual or group health insurance that is issued in the State;
each contract that is issued in the State by a nonprofit health service plan; and
each contract that is issued in the State by a health maintenance organization.

Notwithstanding paragraph (1) of this subsection, this section does not apply to:
a contract covering one or more, or any combination of the following:
the following benefits if they are provided under a separate contract:

text.section:
Each policy or contract subject to this section that provides coverage for dependents shall:
include coverage for a child dependent;
provide the same health insurance benefits to a child dependent that are available to any other covered dependent; and
provide health insurance benefits to a child dependent at the same rate or premium applicable to any other covered dependent.
This section does not limit or alter any right to dependent coverage or to the continuation of coverage that is otherwise provided for in this article.
